info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 24 at 6:30PM CDT until May 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR WESTERN DICKENS AND SOUTHEASTERN CROSBY COUNTIES... At 629 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Afton to 5 miles west of Dickens to 3 miles southwest of White River Lake, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. At 622 PM CDT, the West Texas Mesonet near White River Lake measured a wind gust of 62 mph. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Spur, Dickens, White River Lake, Kalgary, Afton, and Mcadoo. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
